Patients with Epileptic Encephalopathy, Early Infantile, 63 present clinical features that include epilepsy, intellectual disability, and a variety of other symptoms. The disease is caused by a mutation in the gene encoding the enzyme succinate dehydrogenase (SDHD), which is involved in the production of energy in the mitochondria.
